functions.description: Tic Tac Toe is a classic 3×3 grid game where two players alternate placing Xs and Os. The goal is to get three in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.
Tic Tac Toe 5 is an extended version of Tic Tac Toe played on a larger 5×5 grid. The aim is to align 4 marks in a row instead of three.
Connect Four is a vertical board game where players drop colored discs into a 7×6 grid. The objective is to be the first to align four pieces in a row in any direction.
Squava is a Yavalath variant played on a 5×5 grid. Players try to create a row of 4 of their symbol while avoiding a row of 3, which results in an immediate loss.

Gomoku is played on a 15x15 board where players alternate placing stones on intersections. The winner is the first to achieve at least five in a row. To ensure fairness we use Swap2 rules for the opening moves.

Gomoku is played on a 15x15 board where players alternate placing stones on intersections. The winner is the first to achieve exactly five in a row (not more). To ensure fairness we use Swap2 rules for the opening moves.
